page.title: 17Local industry
page.content: Near Plaitford there is a disused gravel pit and sand pit.On the site of the sand pit a number of workshops have grown up, and the are still working although the gravel pit isn't. Concrete blocks and beams are made here, next to the Wellow pottery. Other workshops have grown up around these, including a light engineering works, a garden machinery service centre, and a coal merchants. There is also a weighbridge to check the loads of lorries entering or leaving the site. Across the road there are two sawmills. One is very small, and the circular saw is driven by a belt form a tractor. It mainly cuts fencing posts for the wooden fencing panels which are made locally. The other sawmill is powered by electricity and makes a wide variety of posts and planks.
